input: Heat oven to 350°., Mix all ingredients, except potatoes. Stir in potatoes., Pour into ungreased 8 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish or 2-quart casserole., Bake for 45 to 50 minutes, uncovered.
target: condensed cream, milk, onion, green pepper, hash brown potato, salt, pepper

input: Use either an 8 x 10-inch pan or 1 round layer cake pan. Grease pan and sprinkle generously with brown sugar., Mix in medium bowl: sugar, shortening, milk, flour and baking powder. Spread batter in pan over the brown sugar., Dot the batter with margarine and sprinkle generously with brown sugar and cinnamon. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until done.
target: sugar, shortening, milk, flour, baking powder, brown sugar, cinnamon, margarine

input: Combine all ingredients in bowl and blend well with a spoon. Pour into ice cube trays and freeze., When frozen, put 3 or 4 cubes in a glass and pour ginger ale over them., Garnish with cherry, if desired.
target: lemons, oranges, bananas, pineapple, sugar, water, ginger ale, maraschino cherries

input: Cook vegetables in boiling water in large saucepan 20 min., or until tender; drain., Add dressing; mash until light and fluffy.
target: baking potato, cauliflower

input: Grease and flour a 9 x 13-inch pan., In a large bowl, blend cake mix, cinnamon, cloves, zucchini, buttermilk, oil and eggs at low speed until moistened., Beat 2 minutes at high speed., Pour in prepared pan., Sprinkle with nuts and chocolate chips., Bake at 350° for 35 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
target: cake, cinnamon, cloves, zucchini, buttermilk, oil, eggs, nuts, semi-sweet chocolate chips

input: Cream margarine and Crisco; add sugar gradually., Beat until creamy; add eggs, one at a time., Sift dry ingredients and add alternately with milk and vanilla., Bake 1 hour and 45 minutes in 300° oven.
target: margarine, Crisco, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, cocoa, sweet milk, vanilla

input: Using an electric mixer, beat the cream cheese in a medium-sized bowl until fluffy., Stir in the sour cream and seasoning mix and blend., Add the cheese and stir until combined., Refrigerate for at least two hours, but the flavors develop more the longer it sits., Serve with veggies or crackers., Cassies notes: I used reduced-fat cream cheese and sour cream., Feel free to use the full-fat varieties but dont use fat free, the dip wont set well.
target: Cream Cheese, Sour Cream, Mix, Cheddar Cheese

input: Heat 1 tbsp., olive oil in large skillet., Add garlic and onion, and saute until softened., Add mushrooms, saute until lightly browned, stirring occasionally., Add spinach and sherry, and saute until spinach is wilted., Salt and pepper to taste., Season beef tenderloin on all sides with salt and pepper., Laying tenderloin flat, place spinach and mushroom mixture on one half, then bring the other half up and over to cover., Use butcher's string to tie the halves together and secure the filling., Heat remaining olive oil in large skillet., Sear tenderloin on all sides until browned., Heat oven to 425 degrees F., Transfer meat to shallow rack in roasting pan, and roast uncovered 30- 45 minutes until meat is done as desired., Remove meat from pan and let rest, covered with foil, about 10 minutes before serving., Cut into 1/2 inch slices to serve.
target: olive oil, garlic, onion, mushrooms, sherry, salt, pepper, beef tenderloin

input: Beat butter at medium speed with an electric mixer until creamy., Gradually add sugar, beating well., Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition., Combine flour and baking powder., Add to butter mixture alternately with milk, beginning and ending with flour mixture., Mix after each addition., Stir in vanilla., Divide batter in half., Stir spices, raisins and pecans into one part., Pour plain mixture into 2 greased and floured 9-inch round cake pans., Pour spice batter into 2 (9-inch) greased and floured pans., Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean., Cool in pans on wire rack 10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely on wire rack., Prick cake layers at 1-inch intervals with toothpick., Spread frosting on layers, starting with spice layers, ending with plain layers. Cover top and sides with frosting.
target: margarine, eggs, milk, vanilla, ground cloves, pecans, sugar, flour, baking powder, cinnamon, raisins

input: Preheat an oven to 325 F. Sprinkle ribs with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add the ribs and brown evenly on all sides, about 5 minutes. Transfer the ribs to paper towels to drain briefly., Add onions to the same pot and saute over medium-high heat, until browned, about 5 minutes. Add the carrots and saute until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes longer. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Stir in the tomato sauce, barbecue sauce and beef broth. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 1 minute to blend the flavors. Add the ribs to the sauce., Bake until the meat is very tender, turning ribs occasionally, about 2 1/2 hours. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Place on warm plates and serve immediately.
target: lean, salt, freshly ground pepper, vegetable oil, onions, carrots, garlic, tomato sauce, barbecue sauce, beef broth

input: Place all ingredients in a blender or food processor and whiz., Store, tightly covered.
target: parsley, sage, rosemary, thyme, onion powder, paprika, fresh ground black pepper, cayenne pepper

input: Mix all ingredients and pour into unbaked pie shell., Bake 45 minutes at 350°., Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.
target: eggs, white sugar, brown sugar, oatmeal, coconut, butter, vanilla, pecans

input: Heat oven to 350 degrees F., Mix 2 Tbsp. Cooking Creme and tandoori paste in medium bowl. Add chicken; toss to coat. Refrigerate 30 min., Heat oil in medium nonstick skillet on medium-high heat, Add chicken mixture; cook and stir 5 min. or until chicken is cooked., Combine chili sauce and tomato paste; spread onto bread. Top with onions and chicken; place directly on oven rack., Bake 8 to 10 min. or until pizzas start to brown around edges. Top with spoonfuls of remaining Cooking Creme; bake 2 min. or until heated through. Top with arugula and cilantro. Cut in half.
target: Garlic, tandoori paste, chicken breasts, oil, sweet chili sauce, tomato paste, red onions, tightly packed baby arugula, fresh cilantro

input: Bake cake as directed on package in a 9 x 13-inch pan., Remove from oven and while hot punch holes in cake using a drinking straw., Mix condensed milk and cream of coconut and pour over cake., Cool., Top with Cool Whip and sprinkle with coconut. Refrigerate.
target: condensed milk, cream of coconut, coconut

input: Cut up lettuce in large bowl, dice tomatoes., Mix hamburg, taco mix and cheese together into lettuce and tomatoes., Crush Doritos; fold into mixture., Pour dressing over and mix., Do not prepare until ready to serve.
target: heads lettuce, tomatoes, dressing, hamburg, taco seasoning mix, shredded cheese, Doritos

input: Brown beef, bacon and onion (drain)., Mix remaining ingredients., Bake at 350° for 1/2 hour covered and 1/2 hour uncovered.
target: ground beef, bacon, onion, pork, butter beans, catsup, mustard, salt, light brown sugar, vinegar

input: Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender., Add carrots and celery and cook for 10 minutes or until carrots become a little tender. Add water or broth, potatoes, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil and allow to simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until all vegetables are tender., Add milk and parsley and heat just to boiling., In a separate bowl stir cornstarch into cold water. When completely dissolved add to hot soup, stir and serve.
target: margarine, onion, potatoes, celery, carrots, salt, ground black pepper, chicken broth, milk, parsley, cold water, cornstarch

input: Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add pecan halves, almonds, and pine nuts, and saute, stirring often, 3 minutes or until almonds are light golden brown., Saute onion and garlic in hot oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat 5 minutes or until tender. Add rice, and saute, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Add broth, and cook rice 18 minutes. Remove from heat., Stir in nuts, bacon, ham, and parsley. Cover and let stand 10 minutes., Note: We like to use three different nuts for this recipe; however, feel free to use all the same variety.
target: butter, pecan halves, almonds, pine nuts, onion, garlic, vegetable oil, yellow rice, low-sodium, bacon, ham, parsley

input: Mix together shortening, sugar and eggs. Sift dry ingredients and add to shortening mixture. Chill. Roll into walnut sized balls and roll in mixture of 3 tablespoons of sugar and 2 teaspoons of cinnamon. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 400° for 8 to 10 minutes or until light brown.

input: Saute vegetables in oleo; add salt and pepper to taste. Add corn, pimiento, and rice; stir together and place in a baking dish. Top with grated Cheddar cheese.

input: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray foil with cooking spray., Arrange mushrooms, top-side down, on the baking sheet. Drizzle olive oil over mushrooms and season with salt and pepper. Layer 3/4 of the mozzarella cheese onto mushrooms and top with tomatoes and basil. Cover the top with remaining cheese., Bake in the preheated oven until mushrooms are tender and cheese is melted, 20 to 25 minutes.
target: cooking spray, portobello mushroom, extra-virgin olive oil, salt, mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, fresh basil

input: Prepare and measure Mexican Meat Mix into a zippy., Combine enchilada sauce and chopped tomatos in a medium sauce pan., Cook over medium heat untill mixture boils., Reduce and simmer., After enchilada suace cools measure into a zippy., Measure into zipy bags sour cream and chedder cheese., Cut and place in zippys tomatos and lettuce., To Serve: Heat oil over medium-high heat in a small skillet., Dip on tortilla at a time in hot oil for several secounds then dip in hot enchilada sauce mixture., Set aside., Heat Mexican Meat Mix in a small sauce pan., Place 1/2 c Mexican Meat mix on each tortilla and sprinkle with 2 Tbs., grated Chedder cheese., Roll up and place close together in a shallow casserole dish, seam-side down., Pour remaining sauce over enchiladas., Sprinkle with additional grated cheese., Bake about 15 minutes, until bubbly., Top with lettuce, tomatos and a spoonfull of sourcream.
target: enchilada sauce, tomatoes, vegetable oil, corn tortillas, beef roast, cheddar cheese, sour cream, roma tomatoes, shreded lettuce

input: Mix all ingredients., Place in a small greased casserole dish or crock., Sprinkle with breadcrumbs., Heat at 375° for 30 minutes, until golden brown., Serve warm., Spread on crackers.
target: cream cheese, crabmeat, onion, clove garlic, horseradish

input: Halve, then remove skin and bone from 4 whole chicken breasts (12 oz. each). Pound between pieces of waxed paper until each is about 1/4 inch thick.
target: chicken breasts, butter, oregano, parsley, Jack cheese, bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, Oregano, garlic salt, black pepper

input: Grease 13 x 9 x 2 pan; pour in apple sauce., Mix together all remaining ingredients., Sprinkle mix over applesauce., Bake 30 min at 375 degrees., Serve hot topped with whipped cream.
target: apple sauce, brown sugar, flour, oats, cinnamon, nutmeg, butter

input: Mix the flour, cayenne pepper, all-bran cereal, parsley flakes, garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, taco seasoning, season pepper, curry, basil and oregano together., I use a large size zipper plastic bag and keep it in the freezer., Use for coating any and all types of meat., You can add more of the cayenne and chili powder if you so desire., I usually just throw in what I have at the time I make it so it is never the same twice., It is a great all-around coating.
target: flour, cayenne pepper, all-bran cereal, parsley flakes, garlic, onion powder, chili powder, taco, season pepper, curry, sweet basil, oregano

input: In a shot glass, layer butterscotch schnapps, Irish cream and Jagermeister., Float cinnamon schnapps on top., Drink!
target: butterscotch, irish cream, Jagermeister, cinnamon schnapps

input: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8-inch round pan., Place sun-dried tomatoes into a bowl of warm water until rehydrated, about 10 minutes. Drain and chop., Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion and garlic until onion is translucent, about 10 minutes. Add spinach; cook and stir until thawed and water is evaporated, about 5 minutes. Stir in mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, and feta cheese until well mixed., Whisk egg whites, skim milk, salt, pepper, and basil together in a bowl until very frothy. Carefully stir spinach mixture and 1 tablespoon Parmesan cheese into egg mixture. Pour into the prepared pan; top with remaining Parmesan cheese., Bake in the preheated oven until frittata is set and browned on top, about 25 minutes.
target: tomato halves, extra-virgin olive oil, yellow onion, garlic, spinach, mushrooms, feta cheese, egg whites, milk, salt, ground black pepper, dried basil, Parmesan cheese

input: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F., Combine bananas, sugar, butter, vanilla extract and eggs in a large bowl and beat with a mixer until well blended., In another bowl, combine flour, salt, baking soda and stir. Add flour mixture to banana mixture slowly and beat well., Spoon batter into a 9 inch x 5 inch non-stick loaf pan and bake for 45 minutes, or until a wooden toothpick or clean knife inserted in the center comes out clean., Cool for 15 minutes before removing from the pan.
target: bananas, flour, sugar, butter, eggs, salt, vanilla, baking soda

input: Mix ground beef, rice, egg, onion, carrot, salt and pepper., Mix together vinegar, brown sugar, and tomato sauce. Drop cabbage in boiling water for 5 to 10 minutes. Remove 10 large leaves., Chop remaining cabbage., Place in bottom of crock-pot., Place 2 to 4 tbsp. of meat mixture in center of each leaf., Roll up and use toothpick to hold and place stem side down in crock-pot., Pour on tomato mixture., Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
target: green cabbage, poind groung beef, rice, egg, onion, carrot, salt, pepper, vinegar, brown sugar, tomato sauce

input: Prepare grill or broiler., Combine butter, rind, juice, salt, and pepper in a small bowl., Place corn on grill rack or broiler pan coated with cooking spray. Cook 10 minutes, turning frequently. Remove from heat; brush corn with butter mixture.
target: butter, lime rind, lime juice, salt, ground red pepper, corn, Cooking spray

input: Stir together first three ingredients (use Jell-O dry)., Drain next two ingredients and stir in., Mix in remaining three ingredients., Refrigerate.
target: O, cottage cheese, pineapple, mandarin oranges, coconut, marshmallows, nuts

input: Brown ground beef in Dutch oven over medium heat., Add onions, carrots, celery and garlic; cook 10 to 12 minutes until vegetables are softened., Add chicken broth, tomatoes, Worcestershire sauce, red pepper sauce and pepper; bring to boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer 15 minutes., Meanwhile, melt butter or margarine in small saucepan., Stir in flour., Cook over medium-high heat, stirring until deep brown., Whisk into soup; cover and simmer 15 minutes more., Makes 11 cups.
target: lean ground beef, onions, carrots, garlic, chicken broth, tomatoes, Worcestershire sauce, red pepper, freshly ground pepper, butter, flour

input: Beat eggs; cut up onions and pepper., Mix in meal., Add melted oleo; add cheese., Save enough cheese to sprinkle on top., Put in greased iron skillet., Bake at 400° for 30 minutes or until done.
target: meal, eggs, onion, cream corn, pepper, oleo, grated cheese, sweet milk

input: Place all dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl and stir together with a wire whisk., Add the remaining ingredients and beat on medium speed for 2 minutes., Pour into greased and floured cake pans, filling each pan a little over half full., Bake in a preheated 325-degree oven until cake tests done. Baking time varies depending on the size of pans used., For a chocolate cake, use a chocolate cake mix and substitue 3 whole eggs for the egg whites., To add liqueur flavors, substitute alcohol (champagne, Kahlua, etc.) for 1 cup of the water.
target: White Cake Mix, All-purpose, Sugar, Salt, Water, Vegetable Oil, Vanilla, Almond Extract, Sour Cream, Egg Whites

input: In medium bowl, mix together yogurt, eggs, oil, feta, salt, and sugar., Sift together flour, baking powder, and baking soda. Slowly add the yogurt mixture and stir well., Pour into a well-greased 9x9 inch baking dish., Lightly sprinkle with paprika and caraway seeds., Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean., Serve warm with butter.
target: plain yogurt, eggs, olive oil, feta cheese, salt, sugar, baking soda, flour, baking powder, paprika, caraway seed

input: Place the fat in a large, heavy pot with 1 cup of water., Heat over a medium to low flame and cook slowly, stirring with a wooden spoon to avoid sticking and scorching., Try to push the raw fat under, so it can dissolve and doesn't start to spit as it crisps., Continue to render for 2 hours, until the fat pieces have shrunk to small toasty bits and sink to the bottom of the pot., The rendered fat should be clear yellow., Let the lard cool and settle for 10 minutes, then strain through a sieve lined with 2 layers of cheesecloth., Cool for 1 hour, then pour into a heatproof glass container., Lard keeps for 3 months., Tightly cover in the refrigerator.
target: fresh pork fatback

input: Season the tuna lightly with salt and pepper., Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat., Add the tuna and sear to your desired doneness: about 1 1/2 minutes per side for rare, 2 1/2 minutes per side for medium., In a large bowl, combine the prosciutto, sun-dried tomatoes, artichoke hearts, olives, red bell pepper, anchovies, and greens., Add the remaining olive oil and the lemon juice and toss to coat., Pile the mixture on top of the tuna and serve.
target: tuna, Kosher salt, extra-virgin olive oil, tomatoes, oil, olives, red bell pepper, anchovies, salad greens, lemon juice

input: Bake cake according to directions in a 9 x 13-inch pan., While cake is still warm, pierce with fork and pour condensed milk mixed with pina colada mix over cake., Let cool and ice with Cool Whip. Sprinkle with coconut and refrigerate.
target: white cake mix, pina colada, condensed milk, grated coconut

input: Preheat oven to 350°., Mix together sugar, flour, baking soda, salt and nutmeg., Add eggs, butter, mango and lemon juice.	Mix well., Stir in walnuts and raisins., Pour into buttered loaf pan. Cook 60 to 75 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean., Cool on a rack., Best cut the next day.
target: sugar, baking soda, flour, salt, nutmeg, eggs, butter, lemon juice, mango, walnuts, raisins

input: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms, salt and pepper. Saute until mushrooms start to give off liquid, about 5 minutes. Add marinara and cook, stirring occasionally, until warmed though, about 3 minutes. Keep warm., Set a rack 3 inches from heat source and preheat broiler to high. Line a broiling pan with foil; lightly oil foil. Arrange polenta on broiling pan and broil until lightly browned, 3 to 4 minutes. Turn and sprinkle with Parmesan. Broil until lightly browned and hot, 3 to 4 minutes longer., Divide polenta among 4 plates. Top with mushroom ragout. Garnish with parsley.

input: Mix the Jell-O, cornstarch and sugar together and set aside. In saucepan, bring 1 cup of water to boil., Slowly add dry Jell-O mixture, stirring constantly to blend., Bring to second boil and boil for 1 minute., Remove from heat and cool., Arrange fresh berries in baked pie shell., Pour cooled filling over berries. Refrigerate at least 1 to 2 hours., Serve with whipped cream.

input: Preheat oven to 350 F., Mix all ingredients and form into 12 balls., Place balls on baking sheet and bake for 35min or until done.

input: Mix and press in baking pan, approximately 13 x 9-inch. Bake 8 minutes at 400°. Cool.

input: Pour boiling water and soda over the dates and set aside. Cream together the oleo and sugar., Add the vanilla and egg; beat well., Add the flour and mix., Pour dates and water mixture over and mix together., Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes., Makes 3 small size loaves.
target: soda, boiling water, dates, oleo, sugar, vanilla, egg, flour, nuts

input: Generously grease large baking sheet and set aside. Combine sugar and corn syrup in 2 quart glass measure bowl. Cook on high for 4 minutes. Stir in peanuts with wooden spoon and cook on high for 4 minutes. Stir in butter and vanilla and cook on high for 2 minutes. Add baking soda and stir until mixture is light and foamy. Pour on prepared baking sheet. Spread quickly to edges using back of wooden spoon. As candy cools stretch to a thin sheet using palms of hands. Cool completely before breaking into pieces. Store in airtight container.
target: sugar, corn syrup, peanuts, butter, vanilla, baking soda

input: Mix pecans, flour, sugar and butter in a 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake for 25 minutes; cool well., Blend cream cheese, confectioners sugar and 1/2 container of Cool Whip., Spread on base., Mix puddings and milk., Pour over cream cheese mixture., Ice with remainder of Cool Whip., Top with shaved chocolate., Refrigerate overnight.
target: pecans, flour, sugar, butter, cream cheese, confectioners sugar, chocolate instant pudding, vanilla instant pudding, milk

input: Pour the vodka in to a tall glass and add the cranberry juice., Mix well., Add a few blueberries and a generous amount of ice cubes., Serve immediately.

input: Layer as follows in a 9 x 13-inch pan: Layer 1, chicken; layer 2, sour cream and chicken soup mixed together., Mix together crackers and poppy seed and make layer over sour cream and soup mixture., Fourth layer, drizzle butter over the top., Can be refrigerated at this point or baked for 30 minutes in a 350° oven.
target: chicken breasts, sour cream, chicken soup, crackers, poppy seed, butter

input: Beat butter at medium speed with an electric mixer until creamy; gradually add powdered sugar, beating well. Add milk and liqueur, beating until blended., Shape sugar mixture around cherries, coating completely, and place on wax paper., Microwave chocolate squares and shortening in a 2-cup glass measuring cup at HIGH 1 1/2 minutes or until melted, stirring twice., Dip coated cherries by stems into chocolate mixture, allowing excess to drip; place on wax paper. Let stand until firm. Store loosely covered in a cool place 1 week or until centers soften.
target: butter, powdered sugar, milk, cherry liqueur, chocolate squares, shortening

input: Dreaded Brussels sprouts are one of my two most favorites., Try this, from Time-Life's*Fresh Ways with Vegetables*:, Put the onion, oil, pepper, and 1/2 c. of water in a saucepan., Bring water to a boil over high heat and partially cover pan so a little steam can escape., Reduce heat to medium and cook onion, stirring occasionally, until it is caramelized-i.e., water's about all gone, but a brown syrupy release of the onion's natural sugar is around and about-about one hour., Uncover pan and add in wine to onion., Raise heat to high and boil rapidly until almost all the wine has evaporated-5 - 10 min., About 15 min before the onion's done, steam Brussels sprouts until they are tender., Toss with onion and serve.
target: Brussels, Onion, Virgin extra virgin olive oil, white wine

input: Preheat the oven to 350., Toast the pistachios for about 4 minutes, or until fragrant., Let cool., Transfer to a food processor and finely grind., In a small saucepan, warm the olive oil over moderate heat., Add the oil to the nuts and process until blended., Pour into a jar, stir in the salt and let stand overnight at room temperature.
target: pistachios, olive oil, kosher salt

input: Combine garbanzo beans, salad dressing, water, lemon juice and garlic in food processor., Process until smooth., Serve as a dip with pepper strips, carrots and pita wedges.

input: In a large bowl, stir together the bacon, chicken, shrimp and bean sprouts. Season with soy sauce and garlic salt, and mix until well blended. Place a few generous teaspoons onto the center of one egg roll wrapper at a time, and roll up according to the package directions., Heat enough oil to cover the rolls completely in a large heavy skillet to 365 degrees F (180 degrees C). Fry rolls a few at a time, turning once, until golden brown. Remove with tongs to drain on paper towels. They are delicious plain, or with plum sauce for dipping.
target: bacon, chicken, shrimp, bean sprouts, soy sauce, garlic salt, egg roll wrappers, oil

input: Line a 9 inch square pan with foil and grase the foil with butter; set aside., In a heavy saucepan, dissolve coffee in milk over medium heat., Reduce heat to low., Stir in chocolate chips until melted., Remove from the heat; stir in extracts., Spread into prepared pan., Refrigerate until firm., Using foil, life fudge out of pan., Discard foil; cut fudge into 1 inch squares.

input: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy., Add eggs, one at a time, beating thoroughly after each addition., Beat in chocolate., Add sifted dry ingredients in thirds, alternately with the milk and flavoring, beating until smooth after each addition. Stir in nuts., Using 2 buttered jelly roll pans, spoon batter in 4 rows, the length of the pans (2 rows in each pan)., Arrange batter together in nice even strips, about 2-inches wide., Beat egg white with fork and brush some over each row, being careful not to spill over onto pan., Sprinkle some sugar lightly over top., Bake in 375° oven for 20 minutes., Frost if you wish., Cut in diagonal slices., Makes about 36 slices.

input: Put chuck roast into the crock of your slow cooker; season with chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. Add beef broth, onion, green salsa, green chiles, chopped chipotle peppers, and garlic to the crock., Cook on High for 5 hours (or on Low for 7 to 8 hours)., Shred the beef in the slow cooker using 2 forks; continue cooking on High for another 15 to 20 minutes.
target: boneless beef chuck roast, chili powder, ground cumin, salt, ground black pepper, beef broth, onion, green salsa, green chilies, peppers, garlic

input: Combine chocolate pudding mix with milk according to package directions. Using a whisk, I stirred mine until it was nice and thick, which took 2 minutes. Love that instant pudding!, Spoon pudding into pie crust shells. (You'll have some left over; sorry, you'll just have to eat chocolate pudding. It's a hard job, but somebody's got to do it!) Top with as many marshmallows as you want or can fit, whichever comes first., Place pies under a broiler set at 500°F for about 5 minutes. Warning: Do not walk away! These little guys will go from roasted to toasted in the blink of an eye so be careful. You've been warned., Eat them! They're delicious!

input: Grill steak over medium-hot coals to desired degree of doneness, about 20 minutes for medium, turning halfway through cooking time., Slice steak, diagonally across grain, into scant 1/4-inch slices., Combine sliced meat and vegetables in shallow serving bowl., Pour dressing over and toss., Serve immediately or refrigerate several hours., Serve chilled., Makes 6 servings.

input: You may use suckers, Northern or crappies for this recipe.
target: pickling salt, water, white sugar, white vinegar, onions, fillet, white vinegar, pickling spices, sweet Port wine

input: Preheat oven to 350°., Combine in large mixing bowl: Crisco, sugar, eggs and cold water until well mixed., Add to mixture: flour, baking powder, soda and salt., Add mashed bananas., Pour mixture into two greased and floured loaf pans., Cook 40 to 45 minutes., Cool approximately 30 minutes.

input: Combine all ingredients in a 2-quart casserole dish., Cook, uncovered, for 1 hour at 350°., Stir occasionally to mix all ingredients well as the butter and cheese melt., Let sit for 10 minutes before serving., Children especially enjoy this casserole.

input: Wrap each hot dog with one strip of bacon and secure the ends with toothpicks., Season with AP BBQ & Steak Rub and refrigerate until needed., Make the Easy Nacho Cheese Sauce (recipe in my profile)., Cover with a lid and turn to "very low heat" and keep warm., Set up your grill with a 3 Zone Fire with a drip pan in the front., Place bacon wrapped hot dogs on the grill over the drip pan., Add a handful of what wood chips directly to the fire and cook at 350AF for 20 to 30 minutes or longer., Continue cooking until the bacon is crispy, just keep an eye on them., Top hot dogs with nacho cheese sauce and a few jalapeno slices and some lightly crushed corn chips., .
target: beef, bacon, Rub, buns, corn chips, nacho cheese sauce

input: Bring rice and 2 3/4 cups water to a boil, covered, then simmer 20 minutes. Let sit 10 minutes. Turn out onto a rimmed baking sheet and toss gently with salt., Moisten your hands with water and divide rice into 8 balls. Set 1 ball on a piece of plastic wrap, pinch off half, and flatten remaining rice into a small round. Layer with avocado, salmon, and about 1/2 tsp. furikake, leaving 1/2-in. border around filling. Top with rest of rice and use plastic to help you form a blunt triangle about 1 in. thick. Repeat with remaining rice and fillings., Position base of 1 rice triangle facing you. Center 1 nori strip over rice, angling it diagonally from left bottom corner. Tuck ends around triangle. Place 2nd nori strip over first, angled the opposite way; tuck ends under. Lay 3rd strip over and flush with base of triangle and tuck ends under., *Find furikake at Asian grocery stores., Note: Nutritional analysis is per triangle.
target: sushi rice, salt, avocado, nova salmon, furikake

input: In a large saucepan, bring water and salt to a boil. Stir in oats. Cook 1 minute over medium heat, stirring occasionally., Remove from heat; stir in sugar and vanilla. Top servings with cinnamon-sugar, cranberry sauce and walnuts.

input: Soften cream cheese., Add onion to mayonnaise., Add cream cheese to remaining ingredients., Spread on Melba toast.

input: Cook cranberries in water until done (they will pop)., While hot, add sugar; stir until dissolved., Then add Jell-O, pineapple and nuts., Pour in 9 x 13-inch glass pan., Let set overnight., In another bowl, crumble up cheese in bottom, then add marshmallows and whipping cream., Cover; refrigerate overnight., Before serving, whip topping and spread over cranberries.

input: Peel, core and cube apples into 1/4 inch dice., In a 12 inch to 14 inch saute pan, heat butter until foam subsides., Add onions and cook until soft and golden brown, about 8 to 10 minutes., Add apples and poppy seeds and cook until edges are softened, about 5 to 6 minutes., Add grappa and lower heat., Meanwhile, grill bread on both sides and place on platter., Place a cheese slice on each piece of bread., Spoon apples over and serve.

input: Beat eggs and milk together., Add salt and pepper to taste., Cook over medium-high heat with the cream cheese.

input: Place strawberries and sugar in food processor., Process until finely chopped, scraping bowl occasionally., With processor running slowly add cream., Process until mixture is smooth and creamy., Serve immediately or freeze in a airtight container up to two weeks., Try using frozen peaches or blueberries in place of strawberries.
target: unsweetened strawberries, sugar, heavy whipping cream

input: Cornbread:, (3 cups sour cream is 1 1/2 containers of the 16 ounce containers)., (2 2/3 cups is about 2 cans of the 14 ounce cans)., Combine first 6 ingredients in order listed, mix well., Pour into greased 9 x 13 inch pan., Bake at 350 degrees for approximately 45 minutes. May take up to 50 to 55 minutes - so you will need to watch it., Make 24 squares of cornbread., For honey butter: Mix soften butter and honey together. Serve with warm cornbread.

input: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt., Add raisins and milk., Mix well and put in baking dish., Mix brown sugar, water and butter., Pour over first mixture., Bake in oven for 30 to 40 minutes at 350°, to 375°., Serve warm., Makes 6 to 8 servings.

input: In ice cream maker, combine Eagle Brand milk, strawberries and milk., Put lid on., Put ice and rock salt between container and holder, adding ice as it melts. Will not need whole bag of rock salt.

input: Preheat oven to 350F., In a bowl whisk together whites, sugar, and vanilla until combined well and stir in flour and coconut., Sprinkle chocolate chips evenly over hot shortbread., Let chips melt and spread evenly over shortbread., Drop small spoonfuls of coconut mixture onto chocolate and with a fork spread evenly., Bake in middle of oven until top is golden, about 30 minutes., Cool completely in pan and cut into 24 bars., Bar cookies keep, covered, 5 days at room temperature.

input: Bake pie shell., Mix sugar, water and cornstarch; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thick., Remove from heat; add Jell-O and strawberries, which have been stemmed, washed and drained., Pour into pie crust., When cool, cover with Cool Whip.

input: Combine paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper in a small bowl to make spice mix., Spread 1/2 of the onion slices in the bottom of a 10-inch skillet. Arrange potato slices in one layer on top, overlapping if needed. Repeat with carrots, zucchini, bell pepper, and tomatoes. Sprinkle garlic over tomatoes. Place turkey chunks on top, taking care to space them evenly over the whole dish. Sprinkle spice mix over turkey, top with remaining onion slices, and drizzle vegetable oil on top., Cover skillet and cook over medium-low heat until turkey is no longer pink in the center and the top layer of onion slices is soft and translucent, about 40 minutes. Remove lid and let stand for 10 minutes. Drizzle with olive oil just before serving.

input: Mix eggs, sugar and evaporated milk in blender., In large bowl, add egg mixture to sweetened condensed milk, Cool Whip and milk; whip until smooth., Add salt, vanilla and peaches., Stir. Pour into can and add milk to fill line if not full., Freeze according to churn instructions., (Other fruits may be used or add extra vanilla for vanilla ice cream.)

input: Cut potatoes in half prior to baking for one hour or until done. (Note: This recipe uses baking sized potatoes so adjust as needed if not using potatoes this large.) Once potatoes are baked, allow to cool and when they are cool enough to handle, scoop the potato out of the skin leaving the skin as a shell to be used later. In a large mixing bowl, add potato pulp and all ingredients listed above. (Adjust spices to your own taste.) Mix all ingredients using either a blender or with a fork depending on how fine you want the potatoes mashed. Once the ingredients have been mixed together, place them back in to the potato skins. Heat oven to 350 and bake potatoes an additional 10 to 15 minutes until the tops are browned.
target: potatoes, sweet onion, garlic, salt, black pepper, ground red pepper, cheddar cheese, Bacon bits, dressing

input: Cook chicken; remove bones and cut in bite-size pieces., Saute celery, onion and mushrooms in margarine., Add corn and soup. Cook macaroni in chicken broth until tender., Drain off any remaining broth and stir in Velveeta cheese until melted.

input: Saute onion and green pepper in butter in a medium skillet until tender. Add flour and salt; stir well. Gradually add half-and- half, stirring until smooth. Add nutmeg and mustard; stir well. Gradually add egg yolks, stirring constantly. Stir in crabmeat; cook over medium heat about 5 minutes. Serve in individual baking shells or dishes, garnishing each with mushrooms and parsley, if desired.

input: Put in blender in order given., Blend on medium speed until blended., Blend on high until thick and creamy., Stop and stir frequently.

input: Mix together corn flakes and melted butter., Put half of the mixture in a 9 x 13-inch casserole dish., Sprinkle onion over cabbage. input: 1. Using a box grater, grate the florets off of the head of cauliflower., 2. Combine the cauliflower, onion, coconut oil and seasonings in a pan and saute over medium heat for 10 minutes or until the cauliflower is soft and tender. Then you're ready to serve!

input: 1. Add olive oil to a large saucepan and saute onion, carrot, and celery about 3-4 minutes or until colors brighten and vegetables begin to soften but not brown., 2. Stir in chicken broth, potatoes, and cayenne pepper and bring to a boil., 3. Reduce heat, and simmer, covered, until the potatoes are tender (10-15 minutes.), 4. Stir in cheese, heating just until it's melted., 5. Add pancetta and stir well to combine., 6. Add salt to taste, and serve immediately.

input: Boil the chicken in about 3/4 of a litre salted water for about 30 min .Remove the meat to cool, set the stock aside.Mix the jogurt and egg yolk and fill into a pan with about half a litre of the stock mix well , stir all the time and reheat to just boiling point.Cut or rip the chicken into small pieces add to soup.Reheat just to boiling point.Season well with salt and pepper., Add butter to frying pan and melt , add the paprika.Do not fry just melt butter until it is clear , drizzle mixture over the plated soup.Decorate with some flat parsley., This will make 4 small portions as a starter or serve two or three people as a main .

input: Line two cookie sheets with waxed paper., In large saucepan, bring to a boil the sugar, butter, milk, cocoa powder, and salt., Boil 1 minute, stirring constantly., Remove from heat and add oats, peanut butter, and vanilla., Stir well., Drop by rounded spoonful onto waxed paper and chill.

input: Preheat oven to 350F and fill 12 muffin holes with liners. Coat a large bowl with cooking spray. Place turkey in prepared bowl; season with salt and pepper, mix until incorporated and set aside. Place butter and oil in a large frying pan and cook over medium heat until butter melts; add onion. Saute onion over medium heat until wilted and translucent, about 5-8 minutes. Add garlic; cook for 1-2 minutes. Add mushrooms and saute until they begin to give off moisture, about 3-5 minutes. Add soy sauce and sherry; cook until mixture begins to resemble a paste, about 5-10 minutes. Toss in parsley and cook for 1-2 minutes mores. Add mushroom mixture to turkey and mix until thoroughly incorporated. Drop by heaping tablespoons into prepared muffin tins until 2/3 to 3/4 full. Bake muffins until center seems firm to the touch and turkey is completely cooked through, about 22-27 minutes.
target: cooking spray, lean ground turkey, salt, black pepper, butter, olive oil, onion, garlic, cremini mushrooms, soy sauce, sherry cooking wine, parsley

input: Whisk all ingredients together in a small bowl. Enjoy as a dip or salad dressing. Store in an airtight container in the fridge.

input: Cook quinoa in the small sauce pan for approx 20 minutes, then drain and set aside., Remove the broad beans from the pods and boil in the small saucepan for approximately 5 minutes. Using the same saucepan cook the sugarsnap peas for 2-3 minutes., In the large serving bowl combine quinoa, lamb lettuce, chopped radish & spring onion, halves of tomatoes, broad beans and garden peas (removed rom the pods)., Mix the summer salad with maple syrup and fresh lemon juice. Top it with the pomegranate. Serve with cold sparkling water or freshly made lemonade.

input: Combine all dry ingredients in large bowl., Combine all wet ingredients in a second bowl., Add wet ingredients gradually to the dry ingredients and mix well each time., (We do it in thirds - i.e one third of the dry ingredients, then one third of the wet ingredients, and so on., )., Bake at 375F for 20-25 minutes.

input: Preheat oven to 350-degrees F., Place apple slices in a 2-quart casserole or baking dish., Pour cider over apples., Combine next ingredients ingredients (flour-salt) in a bowl., Cut in butter or margarine with two knives until mixture is crumbly., Spoon mixture over apples, spreading evenly to cover all the apple slices., Bake for 40-50 minutes or until apples are tender and topping is light brown.

input: Heat a heavy skillet with 1/2-inch vegetable oil until hot, not smoking., Dip fish in batter to coat evenly, and lay fish strips in pan, not touching., Cook until golden, about 2 to 3 minutes., Turn and cook until golden., Drain on paper towels and season with salt, to taste., Heat a dry cast iron or heavy skillet and warm flour tortillas until heated., Assemble tortillas by layering fish, cabbage, mayonnaise, and salsa., 3/4 cup white flour, Dash yellow mustard, Beer to make batter consistency of pancake batter, Stir together until incorporated., 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons milk, 1 or 2 smoked, canned chipotle chiles, 1 cup chopped canned or fresh tomatillo, 1/4 cup chopped canned or fresh jalapeno peppers, 1/4 cup diced onion, 1/4 cup chopped cilantro leaves, 1/4 cup canned green chiles, Put ingredients in a bowl and mix., Process ingredients together, and then simmer over medium high heat until just boiling., Serve warm., If using fresh ingredients, simmer until cooked.

input: Cut watermelon into squares., Remove all red., Soak 2 1/2 to 3 hours in lime water., Rinse very well and put in cold (ice) water. input: Cut chicken into generous chunks., Spray Mazola in a large casserole dish., Melt margarine and mix stuffing, stirring well. input: Preheat oven to 375° F., , Coat 10 muffin tins with baking spray or line cups using liners., , Combine all dry ingredients, flours through cinnamon in a large bowl., , In a small bowl, whisk the yogurt and eggs together., , Gently fold the yogurt-egg mixture into the dry ingredients until just combined. Fold in the melted butter, chopped peaches, half and half, and blueberries. Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups., , To make the topping: In a small bowl, mix together brown sugar, and cinnamon. Cut in butter until mixture is mixed completely. Sprinkle topping evenly over muffin batter. Bake until golden and a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffins comes out clean, approximately 25-30 minutes., Let the muffins cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then flip out onto a wire rack and let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

input: In a large skillet, cook sausage and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Transfer to a greased 3-qt. baking dish. input: Sprinkle a cucumber with salt and roll it hard on a cutting board., Slice it very thinly using a vegetable peeler., Make two cuts halfway through the slices that are a bit nearer to the ends than the 1/4 points, as shown in this photo., Put the two cuts together like this., Secure with a pick, and the ribbon is done., Stuff a piece of cucumber in the cheese flavored chikuwa., Cut each one in half diagonally, and stick a pick-pierced cucumber ribbon on each piece., (You can use regular chikuwa and stuff them with cheese and cucumber instead!), Add a cherry tomato decoration to make your pinchos even cuter., I served them as hors d'oeuvres along with tomato bruschetta., Please take a look at"Party hors d'oeuvres Pinchos."

input: Thinly slice the fruit., Cut into any shape or size you like., Use dried fruit as-is., Put the fruit in an air-tight container, and pour in enough brandy (or rum) to cover everything., If possible, leave to soak for a month., If not, leave it for at least a week, before using in cakes and cookies., This photo shows pear soaked in rum for over 6 months., I used brandy-soaked fruit in this recipe : "Extravagant Fruit Pound Cake with Aromatic Brandy".

input: 1., Marinate chicken in lemon juice, garlic, mixed herbs, salt and pepper., Leave it for 1 hour., 2., Boil the pasta until cooked., Drain and run through cold water., Rub some oil through all the pasta so that it doesnt stick., 3., Melt butter in a pan; add flour., Cook this mixture till the flour loses its rawness and floury flavor., Slowly add milk while stirring so that no lumps are formed., Let it cook on slow heat., 4., Taste to see if all the ingredients are well incorporated and you cant taste flour and milk separately., If it gets too thick, just add more milk., Add salt and pepper to taste., Set aside., 5., Heat some oil in a pan and cook the chicken strips., When they are cooked and golden brown, add the white sauce to this pan, so that the white sauce takes on the tangy herby flavor as well., Let it cook till all the flavors are well mixed., 6., Serve the sauce/chicken hot with the pasta.

input: Add 1/4 cup very cold water to a bowl. Sprinkle water with gelatin. Set aside to soften 5 minutes or so., Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan add Coconut Milk, sugar and salt. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until set, 4 hours or more, preferably overnight., Serve right from custard cups; or unmold by running a small knife around edges and dipping cups in hot water for 20 seconds., Invert cups onto plate and top with chopped, or pureed mango.

input: Heat oven to 350F., Prepare cake batter as directed on package; pour into greased 13x9-inch baking dish., Beat dry pudding mixes, granulated sugar, milk and water with whisk 2 min., ; pour over batter in dish., Place baking dish on baking sheet., (Baking sheet will catch any sauce that might bubble over sides of dish as dessert bakes.), Bake 55 min., to 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean., Cool 20 min., (Sauce will thicken slightly as it cools.), Sprinkle with icing sugar., Serve warm., Refrigerate leftovers.

input: Combine flour, baking soda, salt, sugar and cinnamon in a large bowl. Add eggs and oil, stirring until dry ingredients are moistened. Do not beat. input: Bring the stock to a simmer in a medium saucepan and keep it warm over low heat., Heat the olive oil in a large, wide casserole., Add the onion and cook over moderately low heat, stirring often, until it softens, about 8 minutes., Add the rice and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until the grains are coated with the oil., Add the wine and boil until almost evaporated., Stir in the squash., Add about 3 cups of the hot stock to the casserole and cook, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until the rice has absorbed most of the stock., Continue to cook the risotto, adding the stock 1 cup at a time and stirring constantly between additions until it is absorbed., The risotto is done when it is creamy and the rice is just tender, about 30 minutes total., Remove the casserole from the heat., Stir in the Parmigiano-Reggiano and season with salt and pepper., Spoon the risotto into 12 warmed bowls or soup plates and serve at once.

input: Melt a knob of butter in a pan, then leave to cool down., Meanwhile, place the flour in a bowl., Break the eggs into the bowl and pour in the milk., Mix until it turns into a smooth batter., Stir in the now cooled melted butter and leave to stand for about half an hour., This lets the starch expand and makes the finished pancake lighter., When you're ready to cook the pancakes, melt a little more of the butter along with a bit of oil in a frying pan., A non-stick pan is the best., When it is quite hot pour 1/4 cup batter into the pan., Swirl it until it covers the pan and you have a thin, even layer that should set almost immediately., After about a minute it should be ready to flip., Cook for 30 seconds on the other side and then tip onto a plate., Repeat until you have used up all the batter.

input: Line a 9-inch square baking dish with two 24-inch sheets of plastic wrap, allowing excess to hang over sides. Spoon chocolate-chip ice cream on top and cover with 8 cookies. Repeat layering twice with 1/4 cup peanut butter, a pint of ice cream and more cookies. Cover with overhanging plastic wrap and press down to compress layers. Cover with second sheet of plastic and freeze for at least 3 hours and up to 1 week., To unmold, dip pan into warm water, unwrap cake and invert a platter on top. Flip cake over and remove pan and wrap. Return cake to freezer., Whip cream and confectioners' sugar until stiff. Spread on cake and sprinkle with chocolate, if desired.

input: Soak pinto and kidney beans in 4 cups water overnight or at least for 6 hours., You could use canned beans I should think, but I haven't so you will have to use accordingly., This recipe is with bulk beans., Bring to a boil the beans and 8 cups of water., Reduce heat and simmer, covered for about 15 minutes., Add rice, onion, green pepper, chili powder and oregano, and bring to a second boil., Reduce heat and simmer for about 40 minutes or until the rice and beans are tender., Be sure to check the kidney beans at this step, because they tend to take longer., Add blended tomatoes, garlic, parsley, and butter, and simmer about 15 minutes or until the flavors are blended., Turn burner to lowest heat Add green onions and corn chips., In blender, blend together sour cream, chees, avocado and enough of the hot soup so that mixture can blend., Blend until smooth., Remove soup from heat, stir in blended mixture., Season to taste., Serve, topped with additional sliced green onions, if desired.

Remove from heat., Arrange basil in a serving plate. Put sambal on top of it. Best serve with plain steam rice.

input: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease or line a baking sheet with parchment paper., Slice apples in 1/4 inch rounds. Rub slices with lemon to prevent browning. input: Drain and reserve juice from blueberries and pineapple., Add to juice enough water to make 4 cups., Heat 2 cups of the liquid to boiling., Dissolve raspberry jello in it., Add the remaining 2 cups liquid and fruit., Add marshmallows and pecans., Let jell slightly., Then fold in whipped cream., Let jell for 3 or 4 hours before serving.

input: When you are making this, it's easier to work on cardboard., Soak the chocolate writing pens in hot water to soften., Arrange 5 pieces of wafers for the floor, and glue with the chocolate pen., Stand 4 wafers up on each side of the floor., Glue with the pen one by one., When all the walls are up, arrange the wafers for the roof., Place them so that the roof extends out past the walls a bit, then glue to secure., Lay the cigarette russe on the roof one by one., Alternately use one large one, then two small ones., Glue them well to secure., Stick the door and put the windows on the other 3 walls., Let it sit in somewhere cool or in the fridge to harden., Transfer to a decorative plate, sprinkle on powdered sugar for snow, and it's done!
target: Wafers, russe, cookies, cookie, Chocolate writing pens, sugar, baumkuchen, Wafers

input: Combine soy sauce, vinegar and sugar in a small bowl., Heat a large skillet or wok over medium heat., Brown sesame seed and set aside.
target: soy sauce, cider vinegar, sugar, sesame seed, olive oil, red pepper, ginger, garlic, broccoli

input: In saucepan, combine chocolate and confectioners sugar. Gradually add warm milk, stirring constantly., Place over low heat and stir until mixture reaches the boiling point., Remove from heat and stir in softened gelatin, granulated sugar, vanilla and salt., Chill until slightly thickened., Beat with rotary beater until light and fluffy., Fold in whipped cream., Pour into a 2-quart serving dish and chill for 2 to 3 hours., Serves 10 to 12.
target: unsweetened chocolate, confectioners sugar, warm milk, unflavored gelatin, sugar, vanilla, salt, heavy cream

input: Melt the butter and keep it hot, but do not brown., Put the yolks, lemon juice, salt and cayenne in the container of en electric blender., Blend on low speed, gradually adding the hot butter until the sauce is thickened and smooth., About 3/4 cup.
target: butter, egg yolks, lemon juice of, salt, cayenne pepper

input: Preheat oven to 350F., Mix beans and chicken., Spread half the bean mixture into 8-inch square baking dish; cover with 4 of the Singles., Repeat layers., Top with tomatoes., Mix bread crumbs and butter; sprinkle over tomatoes., Bake 20 min., or until heated through.
target: black beans, chicken, Singles, tomato, bread crumbs, butter

input: Heat oven to 375 degrees F., Combine first 5 ingredients; stir in 1 cup mozzarella., Spread onto noodles, adding about 1/3 cup to each; roll up., Mix sauce and crushed pepper; spread 1/2 cup onto bottom of 13x9-inch baking dish., Add lasagna rolls, seam sides down; cover with remaining sauce and mozzarella., Bake 25 min., or until heated through.
target: egg, Ricotta Cheese, chorizo, Parmesan Cheese, Mozzarella Cheese, lasagna noodles, Pasta Sauce, red pepper

input: Cook onion, celery and garlic in shortening until tender, but not brown., Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, salt, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder and hot pepper sauce., Simmer, uncovered, for 45 minutes., Combine cornstarch with water; stir into sauce., Cook and stir until mixture thickens and bubbles. Add shrimp and green pepper., Cover, simmer 5 minutes., Spoon hot creole into center of parsley rice ring, made by combining 1/4 cup chopped parsley with 3 cups hot cooked rice., Serves 6.
target: onion, celery, garlic, shortening, tomatoes, tomato sauce, salt, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, pepper sauce, cornstarch, cold water, shrimp, green pepper

input: Preheat oven to 475°F with racks in upper and lower thirds, with a 4-sided sheet pan in lower third., Toss fries with 2 tablespoons oil in hot sheet pan, then bake according to package instructions until golden and crisp., Meanwhile, pat steaks dry, then rub with peppercorns and 1/2 teaspoon salt., Heat remaining tablespoon oil in an ovenproof 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers. Sear steaks on all sides, about 3 minutes total. Transfer skillet to upper third of oven and roast 9 to 10 minutes for medium-rare. Transfer steaks to a plate and let rest 5 minutes., Add wine to skillet and boil, scraping up brown bits, until reduced by half, about 1 minute. Add water and meat juices from plate and boil briskly until reduced by half, 3 to 4 minutes. Whisk in butter until incorporated. Season with salt and pepper., Sprinkle fries with tarragon. Serve steaks with sauce and fries.
target: fries, vegetable oil, beef, cracked black, red wine, water, unsalted butter, tarragon, Accompaniment

input: Flatten pork slices to 1/2-inch thickness; sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook pork in oil in batches until juices run clear. Remove and keep warm., In the same skillet, saute onion and mushrooms in butter until tender. Add garlic; saute 1 minute longer. Stir in the milk, mustard, soy sauce and honey. Return pork to the pan; heat through. Serve with noodles.
target: pork tenderloin, salt, pepper, olive oil, onion, mushrooms, butter, garlic, milk, mustard, soy sauce, honey, noodles

input: Preheat oven to 400°., In a small bowl combine crushed pineapple with juice, chili sauce, apricot preserves, brown sugar, soy sauce and cornstarch., Mix well., Remove skin and fat from chicken except wings., Arrange chicken in 15 1/2 or 10 1/2-inch roasting pan lined with foil., Spoon pineapple mixture over chicken., Bake 45 to 50 minutes, basting occasionally with pan drippings until juice runs clear when chicken is pierced., Cut pineapple into quarters, then into eight 3/4-inch slices.
target: pineapple, chili sauce, brown sugar, cornstarch, pineapple, apricot preserves, soy sauce

input: Boil and drain noodles al dente., Set aside., Brown meat and drain., Add celery, soup mix and sauerkraut and simmer for 1 hour. Mix soup and water and heat., Add to meat mixture and add noodles., Pour into greased casserole and bake at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes.
target: lean ground, celery, onion soup, sauerkraut, cream of mushroom soup, water, noodles

input: Preheat oven to 375°F. Set aside an ungreased 10- inch tube pan. Place espresso in a cup, add boiling water and stir until smooth. Stir in vanilla and set aside., Sift flour and 3/4 cup of the sugar onto a sheet of wax paper; sift again into a bowl and whisk together., Using an electric mixer, beat egg whites at low speed for 1 minute. Beat in cream of tartar and salt, gradually increasing speed to medium, for 1 minute. Very slowly sprinkle in the remaining 3/4 cup sugar. Drizzle in cooled espresso and continue beating at medium speed until whites are stiff but not dry., Sift about one-third of flour mixture on whites and fold in. Repeat folding in 2 more batches. Pour batter into pan. Bake until a tester comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes., Invert cake onto feet of pan (or place center tube over a bottle) to cool completely. Cut around center tube and side of pan with a thin, sharp knife, invert cake, and remove pan. Place cake right side up on a platter and drizzle Fudge Glaze over top.
target: espresso, boiling water, vanilla, cake flour, sugar, egg whites, cream of tartar, salt

input: Mix well and pour into 3 unbaked pie shells., Bake at 350° for 45 minutes., Nuts are optional.
target: milk, margarine, cocoa, flour, sugar, vanilla, eggs

input: Mix all ingredient together in a bowl., Scoop onto wrap and enjoy!
target: garlic, red onion, quinoa, red wine vinegar, olive oil

input: Cut the cheese into 6 slices, each about 3/4-inch thick., Using your palms, press flour onto each side of each cheese slice, shaking off any extra and set the cheese slices aside., Brush the bread slices with a little olive oil and grill on both sides., In a 12 to 14-inch saute pan, heat the olive oil over high heat., Place the cheese in the pan in a single layer., Cook cheese until a brown crust develops., Turn the cheese over with a spatula and sprinkle with a pinch of oregano flowers., Cook for 2 minutes more., Drain some fat from he pan, add 1/4 cup white wine vinegar and let it flame., When the flames, subside, add another 1/4 cup vinegar and remove cheese to warm plates., Rub the grilled bread slices with the clove of garlic, add them to the platter, drizzle the platter with olive oil and sprinkle with more oregano.
target: provolone, Flour, Italian peasant bread, extra-virgin olive oil, oregano flowers, white wine vinegar, garlic

input: Mix 1 teaspoon salt, sugar, yeast, water, flour and vegetable oil., Mix until it turns to dough like fixture., Let dough rise for approximately 1 hour., Chop spinach and onion., Add lemon juice, olive oil, mint, salt., Mix until well blended., Roll out dough and cut out 5 inch circles., Put 1 tablespoon spinach mixture into the middle of each circle and fold up into triangle shape., Place on Baking sheet and cook 350 for 15 minutes.
target: flour, salt, sugar, yeast, water, spinach, onion, lemon juice, olive oil, mint, salt

input: Cook chicken breast until tender, then cut into small pieces. Combine ingredients and place in a 9 x 12-inch buttered dish., Top with crushed potato chips., Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
target: chicken breasts, cream of chicken soup, water chestnuts, onion, almonds, celery, mayonnaise, egg noodles, potato chips

input: Cube bread and soak in lowfat milk., Set aside., Combine grnd chuck, sausage, onion, celery, salt, and Worcestershire sauce, mix well., Add in soaked bread to egg and add in this to meat mix., Form into loaf and place into a 4 3/4 x 8 3/4 inch loaf pan., Spread Piquant Sauce over top and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.
target: chuck, sausage, bread, milk, eggs, onion, celery, salt, Worcestershire sauce

input: Layer the onions and apples in the bottom of a shallow roasting pan., (I use a large casserole dish) Drizzle two tablespoons of the honey along with 1 teaspoon of the caraway seeds on top of the layer of apple and onion., Mix together apple butter, remaining honey and dijon mustard and reserve., Sprinkle the entire roast with garlic salt and place on the apples and onions., Spread Apple butter mixture on top of the roast and sprikle with the remaining teaspoon of caraway., Cover and bake at 350 for approx., 3 hours or until internal temp of the pork is 160.
target: pork loin, onions, apples, honey, caraway seeds, apple butter, Dijon mustard, garlic

input: Fill a 6-quart pot halfway full of water, set over high heat and bring to a boil., Make an X with a paring knife on the bottom of the tomatoes. Drop the tomatoes into the boiling water for 15 seconds, remove and transfer to an ice bath and allow to cool until able to handle, approximately one minute. Remove and pat dry. Peel, core and seed the tomatoes. When seeding the tomatoes, place the seeds and pulp into a fine mesh strainer set over a bowl in order to catch the juice. Press as much of the juice through as possible and then add enough bottled tomato juice to bring the total to a cup., Place the tomatoes and juice into a large mixing bowl. Add the cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, jalapeno, garlic clove olive oil, lime juice, balsamic vinegar, Worcestershire, cumin, salt and pepper, and stir to combine. Transfer 1 1/2 cups of the mixture to a blender and puree for 15-20 seconds on high speed. Return the pureed mixture to the bowl and stir to combine. Cover and chill for 2 hours and up to overnight. Serve with chiffonade of basil.
target: tomatoes, tomato juice, cucumber, red onion, garlic, extra virgin olive oil, lime, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, cumin, kosher salt, black pepper, basil

input: Cook chicken and dice., Add the salsa, corn, and cheese, and mix well. Set aside., Mix the corn bread according to the pkg. directions, or mix from scatch., Mix the corn bread mixture in with the sour cream, cumin, and garlic powder., Put in a casserole dish and bake following directions on corn bread box or pkg., When cornbread is done, remove from oven, and cut into portion size pieces., Serve hot.
target: skinless chicken, salsa, mexicorn, cheddar cheese, sour cream, cumin, garlic, cornbread mix

input: Sterilize 5 half-pint jars., Peel tomatoes, chop coarsely and place in a 3-quart saucepan., Add lemon and ginger., Bring to boiling, reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, 1 hour., Stir in sugar. Boil, uncovered and stirring often until thick, 25 to 30 minutes, or until candy thermometer registers 221°., Ladle marmalade into hot jars., Immediately cover with 1/8-inch hot paraffin wax., Makes 5 pints.
target: tomatoes, lemon, ground ginger, sugar

input: In a small bowl mix the oil with the spices and black sesame seeds., Put the green beans in a tossing bowl with the oil/spice mixture and toss well to coat., Let it sit for about 10-15 minutes for the flavors to absorb., Pour the contents of the bowl into a large skillet or frying pan and on medium-high heat, move the greenbeans around with a spatula until fully cooked but not shrunken., Makes about two 1-cup servings and doubling/tripling works just dandy if cooking for more people.
target: green beans, olive oil, curry powder, ground cumin, turmeric, garam masala, black sesame seeds

input: In a large punch bowl, blend egg yolks and condensed milk gradually., Add and blend in all ingredients., Refrigerate and then serve.
target: coconut cream, condensed milk, milk, egg yolks, cognac, vanilla, white rum, ground cinnamon

input: Combine ketchup and horseradish in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk., Combine Worcestershire, garlic powder, celery salt, pepper, salt, and beef in a bowl; gently blend with your hands. Form mixture into 4 (3 1/2-inch-diameter) patties., Heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add burgers to pan; cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until desired degree of doneness. Place 1 burger on bottom half of each bun. Top burgers with ketchup mixture, lettuce, and pickle. Top with top halves of buns.
target: unsalted ketchup, horseradish, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, celery salt, freshly ground black pepper, kosher salt, ground sirloin, Cooking spray, buns, dill

input: Lightly spray slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray or line with a slow cooker liner., Place ham with 1/4 cup water in slow cooker., In a small bowl, combine mix, mustard, water and preserves; stir until well blended., Pour glaze mixture over ham., Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours., Slice and serve hot.
target: ham, mustard, water, preserves

input: Combine flour, salt, pepper, and paprika; stir well. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add cheese; stir well. Shape into a ball., Roll dough to 1/3-inch thickness on a floured surface; cut with a 1 3/4-inch biscuit cutter. Place biscuits on greased baking sheets. Bake at 450° for 15 minutes.
target: all-purpose, salt, red pepper, paprika, butter, Cheddar cheese

input: Combine egg yolks and milk in a medium saucepan, blending well., Combine sugar, cornstarch and salt; stir into egg mixture. Cook, stirring constantly, until thick., Pour hot filling into bowl; cover with waxed paper and chill.
target: egg yolks, milk, sugar, cornstarch, salt, chunky peanut butter, vanilla extract, pastry shell, whipped cream, peanuts

input: Preheat oven to 350 degrees, , Sift first 5 ingredients in a small bowl [dry ingredients], , mix sugars (brown and white, butter, vanilla and eggs in large bowl (adding eggs one at a time)(whisk or use electric mixer), , Using electric mixer, slowly blend in dry ingredients to wet ingredients., , After well blended batter is mixed, stir in remaining ingredients., , drop rounded tablespoons onto a baking sheet and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until lightly browned.
target: flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, salt, brown sugar, sugar, butter, vanilla extract, eggs, milk chocolate chips, semi-sweet chips, oatmeal, coconut, pecans, walnuts

input: Puree all ingredients together in a blender until smooth.
target: cucumber, extra virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, fresh chives, parsley, nonfat yogurt, mustard, horseradish, sugar, salt

input: Sift all dry ingredients., Add the rest., Bake at 350° for one hour.
target: sugar, butter, eggs, persimmon pulp, flour, nuts, vanilla, salt, soda, cinnamon

input: Mash bananas and add water., Cream butter or oleo and sugar together., Add egg yolks and beat thoroughly., Sift flour, baking powder and soda together., If using self-rising flour omit baking powder., Sift 3 or 4 times., Add banana mixture to sugar mixture alternately with flour., Add chopped nuts and beat until smooth. Fold in well-beaten egg whites., Bake in two layers and put together with powdered sugar or 7-minute frosting.
target: banana pulp, sugar, butter, eggs, water, flour, baking powder, soda, nuts

input: Heat 2-inches of water to simmering, not boiling, in the bottom of a double boiler., Place the white chocolate chips in the smaller pot and set it over the pot of simmering water., Cook on low heat, stirring constantly until the chocolate is fully melted., Remove from the heat., Cover 2 cookie sheets with waxed paper., Arrange the wooden sticks on the waxed paper, 6 to a sheet., Spoon ghost-shaped blobs of chocolate onto the paper, partially covering each stick., Press 2 candies into each ghost for eyes., Freeze ghosts for 15 minutes, or until hard.
target: white chocolate chips, tiny red cinnamon candies, wooden sticks

input: Mix all ingredients., Drop by tablespoon in hot fat and brown.
target: egg, butter, onion, flour, salt

input: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat., Add rice and stir until coated with the oil., Blend tomatoes or tomato sauce, garlic, onion and 1/3 cup of broth or water in food processor or blender until smooth.

input: Combine all but chocolate and paraffin., Chill; roll into balls and chill again., Dip into chocolate coating and chill.
target: condensed milk, confectioners sugar, butter, peanut butter, semi-sweet chocolate chips, paraffin

input: Place whole block of cream cheese on a microwave or oven safe plate or dish., Pour required amount (usually to cover whole block) of sweet chilli sauce over cheese., Heat cheese to soften- it should still be in block form but soft enough to dig chips etc into it., This would probably be a minute or two in the microwave, or 10 minutes in a 180 degree celcius oven., Serve and enjoy.
target: cream cheese, sweet chili sauce

input: Melt butter, blend in flour., Add milk and broth; cook and stir until mixture thickens., Add parsley, lemon juice, onion and seasonings., Let cool slightly; then add chicken. Chill.
target: butter, flour, milk, chicken broth, parsley, lemon juice, onion, salt, paprika, hot sauce, chicken, egg, cracker crumbs, oil

input: Mix well by hand., Mold into 6 or 8 croquettes., Roll in egg whites combined with condensed milk., Roll in flour, then repeat process second time., Set aside in refrigerator until croquettes get firm., Drop one croquette at a time in hot oil in skillet. Roll over until brown, a process that should take less than a minute., Drain on paper towels.
target: ground sharp Cheddar cheese, egg whites, onion juice, dry mustard, cayenne pepper, condensed milk, flour

input: Bring cocoa, milk, sugar, margarine and vanilla to a boil and boil exactly 2 minutes., Add peanut butter and oatmeal., Drop by spoon on foil and let cool.
target: margarine, sugar, cocoa, milk, peanut butter, vanilla

input: REMOVE large stems from spinach., SAUTE bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp; remove and drain bacon, reserving drippings in skillet., Add shallots to skillet, and saute until tender; remove from skillet., Add spinach, and saute 4 to 5 minutes or until wilted., Set aside., COMBINE mashed potatoes, milk, and butter in a 2-quart microwave-safe bowl., Microwave at HIGH 15 minutes, stirring once., Let stand 2 minutes., Stir in bacon, shallots, and half of crumbled blue cheese., ARRANGE spinach around edges of a serving plate., Spoon potatoes in center, and sprinkle with remaining blue cheese., Makes 4 to 6 servings.
target: Spinach, bacon, shallots, potatoes, milk, butter, blue cheese

input: Melt margarine and cocoa. Add sugar, adding only 1/2 cup at a time, stirring well after each addition and milk., Bring to a boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add 1 tablespoon vanilla. Pour into 2-pint size containers or 1-quart. Keep refrigerated.
target: +, cocoa, sugar, milk

input: Brown meat in butter in 12 inch skillet., Sprinkle with 1/2 the spaghetti sauce mix., Spoon cottage cheese over meat., Top with layer of uncooked noodles and sprinkle with remaining spaghetti sauce mix, basil, parsley and salt., Combine tomatoes, tomato sauce and water., Pour over mix, making sure all is moistened., Bring to a boil; cover and simmer 35 min or possibly till noodles are tender., Sprinkle grated cheese over top., Let stand 5 min before serving.
target: lean grnd beef, butter, spaghetti sauce mix, cottage cheese, broad noodles, basil, parsley flakes, salt, tomatoes, tomato sauce, water, Mozzarella cheese

input: Cream butter and add next 5 ingredients., Combine last 3 ingredients and add to mixture., Mix, if needed., Roll into balls and place on cookie sheets., Flatten with glass dipped in sugar. Bake at 400° for about 8 minutes.
